title.narrative: EDUCATION FOR ALL

description.narrative: Girls and boys have increased permanence in the basic education system, based on intersectoral policies addressing diversity, including contextualized education., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Education â€“ General, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Evaluation, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid), Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021 boys and girls have increased access to quality and responsive health, education and social protection programmes, and actively participate in the design, implementation and monitoring of these services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Girls and boys have increased permanence in the basic education system, based on intersectoral policies addressing diversity,including contextualized education.

description.narrative: UNICEF promoted equitable and inclusive education practices in Brazil through the skills development programmes to face school failure which reached almost 20,000 students. In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, UNICEF strengthened the capacity of municipal and state education policy makers to address the challenges of school closure and developed a set of materials to enhance activities related to digital culture and quality hybrid education. New audio materials for early learning have reached out to more than 135 thousand children and their families. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:15/01/2022
